area_name: Groove Rock aka Leap of Faith Area

content.description: Tater Tot is well-bolted and fun 5.8+ or maybe 5.9 if you're not use to a little slab climbing. It's not all slab climbing, but there's a few smear moves. This is easy to toprope as well, but it has some rope drag, so you might want a long anchor system to extend the anchor over the lip of the climb. The climb is named after my nephew Tate, born Feb. 2020.
content.protection: 8 bolts and a double bolt with chains for an anchor.
content.location: This route is on Groove Rock. It is the most left bolted route on the formation and on the northwest side of the rock.

content.description:
This is a new route as of July 2018. It's on Groove Rock between

Neutral Zone

(5.10a) and

Rules of Acquisition

(5.10). Itâ€™s 4 bolts to a double bolt anchor with chains. In the photo, it's the line with the rope on it.
content.protection: 4 bolts and a double bolt anchor with chains.
content.location: It's on Groove Rock and is southwest-facing.

content.description: The crux is the start, move on to face, and climb using the left side arete.  There are bolts for pro and bolts on top.
content.location: This is on right side of Groove Rock. It's on what appears to be an unattached slab that leans on Groove Rock.

content.description: An excellent route on the face of Groove Rock, this is the bolted slab on the west face, just right of the water groove. Short folks will have trouble getting off the ground. Do a short boulder problem to easy slab, and follow 4 bolts. The first bolt is about 20' up. This has some real friction climbing at the very top and very good rock.
content.protection: 4 bolts and an anchor with chains.
content.location: Right of the groove, the first bolt is about 20' up.

content.description: This is the prominent water groove on the left side of the formation. The guidebook calls it 5.11a, but it feels pretty stout for the grade. Clip a high first bolt, position yourself in the groove and stem, smear, and struggle desperately to the anchor. This route shares an anchor with an unknown two bolt route to the right. It is a cool feature.
content.location: It ascends the left side of Groove Rock.

content.description:
As of May 16, 2018, there is a raven's next with eggs. Consider not climbing this to allow the birds to succeed in breeding.

This route climbs the wall just left of a grungy crack system just left of the groove. It's a bit runout compared to other routes in the area.
content.protection: 4 bolts and an anchor with chains.
content.location: This is the leftmost route, just left of the groove.

pathTokens: Groove Rock aka Leap of Faith Area
